genresAdvancedInfo.name: tamazight
genresAdvancedInfo.description: Tamazight is a genre of traditional Berber music that is popular in North Africa, particularly in Morocco and Algeria. It is characterized by its use of stringed instruments, such as the lute and the mandolin, as well as percussion instruments like the darbuka and the bendir. Tamazight songs often tell stories of love, nature, and everyday life, and are sung in the Berber language.
